required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healthy Volunteer Visibility Study of Micromachined Tags for the Detection of Surgical Sponges
clinical_study.official_title: Healthy Volunteer Visibility Study of Micromachined Tags for the Detection of Surgical Sponges

brief_summary.textblock: Surgical sponges can be accidentally left inside patient's bodies. We are working on special tags (called microfabricated tags) that surgeons can put on their sponges. Then, if the surgeons forget to remove a sponge from a patient, they'll be able to detect these special tags in an x-ray.

detailed_description.textblock: Surgical sponges can be accidentally left inside patient's bodies. We are working on special tags (called microfabricated tags) that surgeons can put on their sponges. Then, if the surgeons forget to remove a sponge from a patient, they'll be able to detect these special tags in an x-ray. We wish to take x-rays of healthy people's abdomens with microfabricated tags lying on them. The x-rays will help us improve our system for detecting sponges left inside people's bodies.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Validate the CAD (computer aided detection) system
primary_outcome.description: X-rays of the microfabricated tag will be taken. These x-rays will be reviewed and the individual tags identified manually and a control file created. The images will then be processed by the CAD (computer aided detection)system and the output will be compared to the control file.

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers will undergo x-rays of their abdomen with or without a microfabricated tag placed on their abdomen in different positions.

intervention.description: Subjects will have 2 x-rays of their lower thorax/ abdomen taken. For each x-ray, a microfabricated tag or no tag will be placed in a different position. The x-rays will take approximately 15 minutes to complete.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy men and women
2. Ages 18 or older -
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Under 18 years of age
2. Pregnant female or if female has not had a negative pregnancy test prior to the research scans.
-
